item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "For after all, the best thing one can do when it is raining is let it rain." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "I dream my painting and I paint my dream." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "Flirting with madness was one thing; when madness started flirting back, it was time to call the whole thing off." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Jennifer Joelle add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney
